page.title: 03MINING
page.content: GLENRIDDING HAS A LONG HISTORY OF MINING. TODAY ALL THE MINES ARE CLOSED, BUT THERE IS STILL PLENTY OF EVIDENCE OF WHAT ONCE WENT ON. THE MAIN MINE WAS CALLED THE GREEN SIDE MINE. HERE LEAD WAS MINED AND USED IN THE MAKING OF LEAD FOR ROOFS AND PIPES . THERE ARE MANY MINE ENTRANCES AND HOLES IN THE GROUND STILL LEFT. THE SPOIL HEAPS STILL REMAIN AS UGLY SCARS ON THE LANDSCAPE. THERE ARE ALSO OLD PIECES OF MINING EQUIPMENT LYING AROUND ON THE FELLS AS WELL AS EVIDENCE OF OLD MINE BUILDINGS. TODAY SOME OF THE OLD MINE BUILDINGS HAVE BEEN CONVERTED TO FORM RESIDENTIAL CENTRES FOR OUTWARD BOUND COURSES. EVEN THE ROADS UP THE VALLEYS WERE ONLY BUILT AS MINE ROADS.
